data.title: Discovering the Hidden Gems: 5 Reasons to Move to Poughkeepsie, NY
data.meta_description: Discovering the Hidden Gems: 5 Reasons to Move to Poughkeepsie, NY | Your Hometown Mover - America's #1 Full-Service Moving Company - Local, Long Distance
data.text:
Reason 5: Education

Education is a major draw for those considering moving to Poughkeepsie. The city is home to a variety of educational institutions, including both public and private schools, as well as colleges and universities.

One of the most notable higher education institutions in Poughkeepsie is Vassar College. Founded in 1861, Vassar is a highly regarded liberal arts college known for its strong academic programs and diverse student body. The college also boasts a beautiful campus that is open to the public, with several museums, gardens, and performance spaces.

Another notable institution in Poughkeepsie is Marist College. Founded in 1929, Marist is a private college known for its strong business, computer science, and communications programs. The college is also home to several research centers and institutes, providing students with opportunities to engage in cutting-edge research.

For those with children, Poughkeepsie also offers a variety of options for primary and secondary education. Poughkeepsie Day School is a private, co-educational school that offers a challenging and diverse curriculum for students from pre-kindergarten through twelfth grade. The Poughkeepsie City School District serves the city’s public school population, with several elementary, middle, and high schools.

Private schools in Poughkeepsie also offer a great education option, Oakwood Friends School is a co-educational, Quaker-affiliated school that offers a challenging academic program for students from pre-kindergarten through twelfth grade.

Poughkeepsie offers a wide range of educational opportunities for students of all ages, from pre-kindergarten to graduate-level studies. The city’s colleges and universities, as well as its primary and secondary schools, provide residents with access to high-quality education, and private schools also offer a great alternative for those seeking a different educational experience.
